intro: Euphorbia illirica, commonly known as the Illyrian spurge, is a perennial plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and unique floral structures. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to arid conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and fleshy, while its flowers are small and clustered in cyathia, a distinctive feature of the genus. Euphorbia illirica is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ecological importance in its native region.
